questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Your company plans to migrate from on-premises to a hybrid cloud deployment.
You are required to make sure that the Microsoft platform used for the migration offers hybrid abilities.
Which of the following options meet the requirement? Answer by dragging the correct option/s from the list to the answer area.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: @Marski, there is no on-premises version of Teams so the answer is still Microsoft SharePoint and Skype for Business

Microsoft SharePoint, Exchange and Skype for business are the services where hybrid configuration is available. Here in the question only Sharepoint and Skype for business available, so the answer is correct.
Ref:https://opdhsblobprod04.blob.core.windows.net/contents/5c7b3adccc6146cab42d4d0f775bec31/13306910ecb68585715ffd3d59c1631d?skoid=2d004ef0-5468-4cd8-a5b7-14c04c6415bc&sktid=975f013f-7f24-47e8-a7d3-abc4752bf346&skt=2022-12-30T10%3A22%3A16Z&ske=2023-01-06T10%3A27%3A16Z&sks=b&skv=2021-10-04&sv=2021-10-04&se=2023-01-06T03%3A19%3A03Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=4LNaFW3umMZRj%2FkaEgTM%2BeJLDjmcrWuv3r%2FJSrKvopY%3D

@Marski, there is no on-premises version of Teams so the answer is still Microsoft SharePoint and Skype for Business

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oNH9i2ssNi9gISG3JGuxUoUhmAA4xCaGahEKv2dRN6Y/edit?usp=sharing

comments.content: Skype for Business has been replaced by Microsoft Teams.

discussion.content: SharePoint and Skype for Business
SharePoint and Skype for Business
Microsoft SharePoint, Exchange and ms teams
Microsoft SharePoint and Skype for Business
Microsoft SharePoint and Microsoft Skype for Business
Sharepoint
SharePoint + Skype
It is Microsoft SharePoint and Skype for Business
Share-point and Skype are correct.
Sharepoint and skype for business are the correct answers.
SharePoint and Skype for business
This should now be Microsoft Teams without a doubt ! And Microsoft Sharepoint !

Sharepoint and Skype for Business is correct.
Refer "Microsoft hybrid cloud for IT architects" image under this link: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/solutions/cloud-architecture-models?view=o365-worldwide
Answer is correct. Sharepoint and Skype for Business

Answer provided is correct. There are only two options that are correct. Either all IT users sign up for Microsoft Insider, or an admin sets update preferecne to Targeted release for selected users (IT).
https://insider.office.com/en-us/
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/admin/manage/release-options-in-office-365?view=o365-worldwide
2-3 are correct
There are only two options that are correct. Either all IT users sign up for Microsoft Insider, or an admin sets update preferecne to Targeted release for selected users
Instruct IT and Set Organizational to Standard

lets be pedantic, only '..update preference to Targeted release for selected users..' is the correct answer since Q says '..making sure that the IT department users (can) obtain..' no need Instruct them

Remember that there are 2 settings to SEPERATE control Office365 and Microsoft 365 Apps.

Answer seems like you both set the O365 update AND the Office Apps though not from the Admin Portal.
It's just for the IT dept in the organization, so it must be targeted updated or requested! so the answer is correct

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You have been tasked making sure that the IT department users can obtain Office 365 preview features prior to it being deployed to the rest of the company's users.
Which of the following are the two actions that would meet your goal? Answer by dragging the correct options from the list to the answer area.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Mycalendar is part of Windows 10 ... so i believe the 5th is Windows 10

comments.content:
Mycalendar is a third-party program that you can install form Microsoft Store

https://apps.microsoft.com/detail/9WZDNCRDCR1W?launch=true&mode=full&hl=en-us&gl=us&ocid=bingstartsearch

discussion.content: It says "Personal Calendar" so I believe Windows 10 Enterprise as you don't need to share.
Do questions like these come often in the exam? Where multiple answers are correct

is correct
The question says "Which component of Microsoft 365".
*Windows 10 Enterprise is not part of it, but Exchange Online is.
Calendar is an Exchange feature so 5 is Exchange.
Eu acredito que a ultima esta incorreta, por o Mycalendar é do Windows 10

comments.content:
Teams is a mix of muliple services supporting it from backend. Storing files in Teams is SHAREPOINT and Teams Calender coming from Exchange Online, Teams groups coming from O365.

NOT Teams specific feature

discussion.content:
Current.

Note that Teams also can do this (should be correct also):
Author a document at the same time as someone else and use document versioning.

If you have Microsoft 365 or another email service based on Microsoft Exchange Online, use Outlook on the web to share your calendar with people inside or outside your organization.

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/share-your-calendar-in-outlook-on-the-web-7ecef8ae-139c-40d9-bae2-a23977ee58d5

https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/msoffice/forum/msoffice_o365admin-mso_teams-mso_o365b/cant-find-calendar-tab-in-the-teams-windows/01d607a7-2307-4bc2-812a-6481ede274a2

The above link would explain why viewing calendar is Exchange Online

comments.content: I think that is because, you need Exchange online to be able to view Calendars in Teams.

discussion.content: 5th row: Teams can view personal calendar too, why must be Exchange Online?

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are the Microsoft 365 administrator for a company.
Which Microsoft 365 components should employees use?
Match each component to its task. To answer, drag the appropriate components from the column on the left to the tasks on the right. Each component may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
NOTE: Each correct match is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
This should be:
Teams
OneDrive for Business
Sharepoint Online
Yammer

Why?
The keyword here is "third-party apps". And not the word "you", that is definitely not the keyword. In both (2nd and 3rd option) descriptions the word "you" is mentioned. So that is really not a correct argument. 

The following elaborates to add an app on Sharepoint.

https://support.microsoft.com/en-au/office/add-an-app-to-a-site-ef9c0dbd-7fe1-4715-a1b0-fe3bc81317cb
Sharepoint is more powerful than OneDrive, it supports third-party apps.

comments.content: YOU, is the keyword here, therefor OneDrive is the answer
I think it's not SharePoint because it specifies using an App. And there isn't a dedicated SharePoint App.

discussion.content: for me the second one could be sharepoint. isn't sharing files associated with shrepoint and not onedrive which is for personal files

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Your organization is considering subscribing to Microsoft 365.
You need to educate stakeholders about how Microsoft 365 components enable effective collaboration.
Match each Microsoft 365 service to the best service description. To answer, drag the appropriate services to the correct descriptions. Each service may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct match is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: i prefer not to comment if it is the correct answer. Just my 2 cents.

"all users in your tenant have access "
Targeted release for entire organization is the answer

A opção "Targeted Release for Entire Organization" no Microsoft 365 permite que todos os usuários de uma organização tenham acesso antecipado a novos recursos e atualizações antes do lançamento geral. Isso permite testar e avaliar as atualizações antes da implementação em toda a organização, garantindo que sejam estáveis e atendam às necessidades da empresa.

I say targeted release selected userse. Because a company can be build up from more then one tenant, because it has other companies and have they could have their own tenants. So from logical standpoint, this should be "targeted selected useres".
Targeted release is correct (Y)

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to ensure that all users in your tenant have access to the earliest release of updates in Microsoft 365.
Which organizational release option should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Standard release is the default setting. It implements updates on final release rather than early release.
First release is now called Targeted release. Targeted release is the early release of updates for early feedback. You can choose to have individuals or the entire organization receive updates early.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/admin/manage/release-options-in-office-365
